place.name: DRAYTON
place.gazetteerText: DRAYTON, a parish in St. Faith district, Norfolk; near the river Wensum, 4½ miles NW of Norwich. It has a post office under Norwich. Acres, 1, 332. Real property, £2, 587. Pop., 451. Houses, 95. The pro. perty is much subdivided. Drayton House was the seat of the Latons. Many of the inhabitants are employed in paper-mills in the adjoining parish of Taverham. The living is a rectory, united with the rectory of Hellesdon, in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £700. Patron, the Bishop of Norwich. The church's chancel was rebuilt in 1865. There are a Baptist chapel, and charities £14. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
